content: r o s e h d c s h a w l c r o c h e t p a t t e r n d e s i g n e d b y h o o k e d h a z e l copyright 2024 www hookedhazel com content pattern notes - 2 pattern - 3 i d love to see and share your work tag me on social media @hookedhazel or share photos of your wips with the hashtag #rosehdcshawl copyright 2024 www hookedhazel com supplies needed dk weight yarn 490 yards sample uses hue loco rose collection 10 mini skeins 6 mm us i crochet hook or size needed to meet gauge darning needle scissors blocking supplies notes chain 2 at the beginning of a row does not count as a st i caked my mini skeins into two balls of yarn - 5 colors each felting the ends together in each ball this allowed me to only work with alternating two balls of yarn and the pattern is written assuming the crocheter will do the same c1 and c2 refer to the balls of yarn - alternate every other row you can carry your ends as you go sample was wet blocked and pinned to dry tassels are optional you can adjust the size of this shawl by adding or removing row repeats i am thrilled to be able to share this no cost pdf pattern with you if you enjoy this pattern check out my other abbreviations offerings on ravelry chain - chain st s - stitch es space - space skip - skip half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet measurements 70 x 27 gauge 4 = 11 sts x 12 row in alternating row of half_double_crochet and *half_double_crochet chain 1 skip 1* - blocked copyright 2024 www hookedhazel com pattern c1 chain 4 join with slip_stitch to first st to form a circle c1 row 1 chain 2 in circle 3hdc chain 2 3 half_double_crochet turn <6 half_double_crochet> c1 row 2 chain 2 3hdc in first st half_double_crochet to chain 2 space half_double_crochet chain 2 half_double_crochet in chain 2 space half_double_crochet in each st until 1 st remains 3hdc in final st <12 half_double_crochet> c2 row 3 chain 2 3hdc in first st half_double_crochet to chain 2 space half_double_crochet chain 2 half_double_crochet in chain 2 space half_double_crochet in each st until 1 st remains 3hdc in final st <18 half_double_crochet> c2 row 4 chain 2 3hdc in first st *chain 1 skip 1 half_double_crochet 1 repeat from * to chain 2 space half_double_crochet chain 2 half_double_crochet in chain 2 space *half_double_crochet 1 chain 1 skip 1 repeat from * until 1 st remains 3hdc in final st <16 half_double_crochet 8 chain 1 sps> row 5 - 40 repeat row 3 - 4 continuing to alternate balls of yarn every other row fasten_off and weave in all ends block using desired method have leftover yarn add a couple tassels to your shawl for the sample
